metadata.title: CVE-2022-24303 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Pillow before 9.0.1 allows attackers to delete files because spaces intemporary pathnames are mishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24303` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.7
python3-pil.imagetk - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.7
No subscription required

python-pil - 6.2.1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
python-pil.imagetk - 6.2.1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pillow package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-4ubuntu0.7').
pillow-python2 package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.1-3ubuntu0.1~esm1').
